hero.headline: Harvard's CS249r Book Explodes: 1,144 Stars Today as Machine Learning Systems Education Goes Open Source
hero.summary: Harvard Edge Computing group's 'Introduction to Machine Learning Systems' book has gone viral on GitHub, gaining 1,144 stars in a single day. The comprehensive open-source textbook covers everything from ML fundamentals to edge deployment, TinyML, and efficient inference—positioning it as the definitive resource for understanding ML systems holistically.
hero.whyItMatters: This signals a fundamental shift in ML education. As AI coding tools like Claude Code and Codex become mainstream, developers need deeper systems-level understanding—not just prompt engineering. Harvard making this knowledge freely available democratizes access to production ML knowledge that was previously siloed in elite institutions.

topStories.title: Google Releases Gemini Computer Use Preview: AI That Controls Your Desktop
topStories.summary: Google-Gemini released 'computer-use-preview' on GitHub, enabling AI agents to interact with desktop applications through visual understanding and input control. This positions Gemini alongside Anthropic's computer use capabilities in the race for agentic desktop automation.

topStories.title: OpenAI Admits Prompt Injection Is 'Here to Stay' as Enterprises Lag on Defenses
topStories.summary: In a December 24 post on hardening ChatGPT Atlas against prompt injection, OpenAI acknowledged that 'prompt injection, much like scams and social engineering, is unlikely to ever be fully solved.' They confirmed that agent mode 'expands the security threat surface' with no deterministic guarantees.

topStories.title: Timescale Releases pg-aiguide: MCP Server for Better PostgreSQL AI Code Generation
topStories.summary: Timescale launched an MCP server and Claude plugin specifically for PostgreSQL, helping AI coding tools generate better Postgres code. With 321 stars today, it provides skills and documentation context that dramatically improves SQL generation accuracy.

topStories.title: Context Engineering Replaces Prompt Engineering as the New Frontier of AI Control
topStories.summary: Industry consensus is shifting from clever prompt wording to designing environments where AI can think with depth and consistency. Context engineering focuses on building frameworks that maintain meaning through memory, metadata, and structure—not just rephrasing prompts.

trendingSkills.description: Identifies critical gaps in requirements by framing them as structured, decision-forcing clarification questions without offering solutions.

newMcpServers.name: rust-mcp-filesystem
newMcpServers.description: High-performance, async, lightweight MCP server for secure filesystem operations. Read-only by default with token-efficient large file handling optimized for LLMs.

newMcpServers.description: Browser and API automation for Claude Desktop, Cursor IDE, and other MCP clients. Full Playwright capabilities for web testing and automation.

newMcpServers.name: kubectl-mcp-server

newMcpServers.name: apify-mcp-server
newMcpServers.description: Access to Apify's marketplace of web scraping, data extraction, and automation tools. Extract structured data from social media, e-commerce, and any website.

notableHooks.name: Stop Continuation Evaluator
notableHooks.description: Uses a prompt-based hook to intelligently evaluate whether Claude should continue working. Checks if all tasks are complete before allowing session to end, preventing premature stops.

notableHooks.name: Bash Command Validator
notableHooks.description: Python script that validates shell commands against rules before execution. Suggests 'rg' instead of 'grep', blocks dangerous patterns, and enforces team conventions with exit code 2 to block.

notableHooks.name: MCP Tool Matcher
notableHooks.description: Pattern-matches MCP tools using the format mcp__<server>__<tool>. Enables custom validation for specific MCP server tools like mcp__github__search_repositories.

tuiTools.name: lazygit
tuiTools.description: Simple terminal UI for git commands. The most popular Git TUI with keyboard-driven efficiency for staging, committing, and branch management.

tuiTools.name: Posting
tuiTools.description: The modern API client that lives in your terminal. Beautiful interface for HTTP requests, collections, and API testing without leaving the command line.

tuiTools.name: rainfrog

tuiTools.name: ATAC

Agent Skills infrastructure with tiered discovery for sophisticated capabilities
Remote Agents support with multi-agent TOML configuration
STOP_EXECUTION functionality and improved hook decision handling
Most advanced agentic coding model with context compaction for long-horizon work
Significantly stronger cybersecurity capabilities—found React vulnerability pre-release
Agent Skills support: reusable instruction bundles with optional scripts

notableQuotes.quote: Prompt injection, much like scams and social engineering on the web, is unlikely to ever be fully 'solved.' Agent mode expands the security threat surface, and even sophisticated defenses can't offer deterministic guarantees.
notableQuotes.author: OpenAI

notableQuotes.quote: Context engineering is replacing prompt engineering as the new frontier of control. It's not about clever wording anymore—it's about designing environments where AI can think with depth, consistency, and purpose.
notableQuotes.author: KDnuggets

notableQuotes.quote: Gemini 3 Flash achieves 78% on SWE-bench Verified for agentic coding, outperforming not only the 2.5 series, but also Gemini 3 Pro. It's available at less than a quarter the cost of Gemini 3 Pro.
notableQuotes.author: Google Developers Blog

prompt: Generated via /generate-news slash command. Claude fetches data from 9 sources in parallel (aggregated RSS feed, 7 web searches, GitHub trending via trotd, SkillsMP feed, Claude Code/Gemini CLI/Codex changelogs, Docker MCP catalog via mcp-find, YouTube trending API, Claude Code hooks docs, awesome-tuis list), deduplicates against the past 14 days of digests, then curates into structured JSON.
